text: Fairfield is a town of Sauk County in the state of Wisconsin, United States. About 1,000 people lived in Fairfield as of 2020. Fairfield is the place where the "sand farm" was bought by Aldo Leopold in 1935. Fairfield has an area of 35.6 square miles. ==References== Category:Towns in Wisconsin Category:Sauk County, Wisconsin
title: Fairfield, Wisconsin
